title: ICT Utilization in Science Lectures: Blended Learning-Based Short-Intensive Course

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: A course designed to enhance practical competencies in science for current professionals, conducted in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment, with learning outcomes measured through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Two or more collaborative activities among learners can be designed and executed using ICT tools in a science lecture environment.
Develop a blended learning scenario combining online and offline activities by applying the TEDDIE learning model
Improve understanding of scientific concepts to over 80% using mobile microlearning content

Learners complete a project addressing a given scientific problem (e.g., environmental data analysis) within three days using ICT tools (Python, data visualization tools, etc.) and achieve over 80% fulfillment in at least four of five rubric items (problem definition, data utilization, technical implementation, result interpretation, creativity).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
